page.title: 12THE START OF JEWISH SABBATH
page.content:
You wake on Friday to a lovely spirit of preparation for the Sabbath. Jewish Schools finish early to prepare for the Sabbath. People go to the bakers for special plaited bread and for cake and biscuits. Others bake their own bread during the week. In late afternoon everyone puts on their best clothes and some men go to a ritual bath called a "Mikvah" while the Women lay the table with fine cutlery,candlesticks and goblets.
At dusk, Men go to a Synagogue for the afternoon and evening services which take about an hour, and then return home to the warmth of the family around the beautifully set table. The day is sanctified and all present enjoy a festive meal.
